title: Whores - Ruiner (EP)  MP3  320k   ak6103
description:
Whores - Ruiner (EP)  MP3  320k   ak6103 What we got Whores....Whores (stylized as Whores.) is an American noise rock band based in Atlanta, Georgia. It is formed by vocalist and guitarist Christian Lembach, bass guitarist Jack Schultz and drummer Travis Owen. The band is signed to Brutal Panda Records and is known for its "intensely cathartic live shows."

Contents

    1 History
    2 Musical style
    3 Band members
    4 Discography
    5 References
    6 External links

History

In 2011, the band released their debut EP Ruiner through Brutal Panda Records. This was followed by Clean EP in 2013, which received attention from music websites such as Pitchfork, Exclaim!, and Sputnikmusic. A split single with the band Rabbits, which mainly consists of The Cure covers, were also released in 2014.

The band has also extensively toured United States, alongside acts such as Fight Amp, No Way and Creepoid in 2012.
Musical style

The band's music is mainly described as "noise rock." It has been described as "a combination of the agitated angst of the Jesus Lizard and the heaviness of the Melvins." MetalSucks writer Vince Neilstein stated that the band is rooten in hardcore punk[10] while Pitchfork Media reviewer Andy O'Connor noted the influences of Melvins, Pissed Jeans and Amphetamine Reptile Records artists.[3] The band also incorporates sludge metal in its sound.

The band also collaborated with many figures of the noise rock scene. The band's first EP was mastered by Harvey Milk drummer Kyle Spence and their sophomore EP was produced by Ryan Boesch, who worked with various acts such as Melvins, Helmet and Foo Fighters.
Band members
